question: All right... I'll swear you in...
answer: You can forget that... Wouldn't be legal anyway.

question: Why? You wanted for a crime, Ethan?
answer: You askin' as a Reverend or a Captain, Sam?

question: I'm askin' as a Ranger of the sovereign state of Texas.
answer: Got a warrant?

question: You fit a lot of descriptions.
answer: I figger a man's only good for one oath at a time... I took mine to the Confederate States of America... So did you, Reverend... Stick close, Aaron...

question: Grab hold!... Uncle Ethan! Somethin' mighty fishy about this trail, Uncle Ethan...
answer: Stop callin' me 'uncle'... I ain't your uncle.

question: Yes, sir.
answer: Don't have to call me 'sir' neither... Nor grampaw neither... Nor Methuselah neither... I can whup you to a frazzle.

question: What you want me to call you?
answer: Name's Ethan... Now what's so mighty fishy about this trail?

question: Think I'll see if I can pick off a sage-hen or two, Martha...
answer: You do that, Aaron...

question: Won't go far...
answer: Lucy!... We don't need the lamp yet... Let's enjoy the dusk a while.

question: Ethan!... Ethan! Uncle Ethan... it's me... Martin!
answer: Out of my way!

question: Mose! Wait!... Ethan!... Mose!...
answer: Lucy?... Deborah? Lucy? You stay out! Nothing for you to see.

question: Leggo...
answer: Don't let him go in there, Mose... Lucy -- Lucy!

question: Ethan... Those girls mean as much to me as though they were my own... Maybe you don't know my Brad's been sittin' up with Lucy... and my Laurie's real fond of Martin...
answer: I'd be obliged if you'd get to the point, ma'am.

question: I am... I am... It's just that I know Martha'd want you to think of her boys as well as her girls... And if the girls are... dead... Ethan, don't let the boys waste their lives in vengeance! Promise me, Ethan!
answer: Come on, if you're comin'...

question: Real sassy.
answer: I didn't give any order to fire!

question: That's all right, Captain... I don't need any formal invitation to kill a Comanch...
answer: You got one now!

question: That'll be the day!... Let's ride.
answer: Four of 'em cut out here... Why?

question: I'll take a look... You keep after the others...
answer: You want us to fire a shot if...

question: Huh...? No... no water.
answer: You all right, Ethan?

question: Huh...? Sure I'm all right...
answer: Say!... What happened to your blanket? Lose it?

question: No, but I saw Lucy all right... She was wearin' that blue dress... an' she was walkin' along...
answer: What you saw wasn't Lucy.

question: It was, I tell you!
answer: What you saw was a buck wearin' Lucy's dress... I found Lucy back there in that canyon... I wrapped her in my blanket an' buried her with m'own hands... I thought it best to keep it from you -- long as I could.

question: Did they...? Was she...?
answer: What've I got to do -- draw you a picture?... Spell it out?... Don't ever ask me!... Long as you live don't ever ask me more!

question: Let's just hope he took some with him...
answer: What you goin' to do?

question: Get some sleep... Tomorrow's another day...
answer: Say it. We're beat!

question: No... our turnin' back don't change anything... not in the long run. If she's alive, she's safe... for a while... They'll keep her to raise as one of their own, 'til she's of an age to...
answer: And you think we got a chance to find her?

question: Hey... What you doin'...? Don't go takin' that stuff...
answer: Ain't worth the mendin'... What you gettin' red-in-the-face for?... I have brothers, haven't I?

question: Well I ain't one of 'em!
answer: I'm a woman, Martie... We wash and mend your dirty clothes all our lives... When you're little we even wash you... How a man can ever make out to get bashful in front of a woman I'll never know...

question: You talk like a feller might just as leave run around nekkid...
answer: Wouldn't bother me... I wouldn't try it in front of pa, though, was I you...

question: Mrs. Jorgensen... Will you look at this?
answer: Why it's just a snip of calico...

question: You ever see it before... like mebbe on a dress Debbie wore?
answer: Yes!... Yes, I remember!... Have they found her, Ethan?

question: Good night... Laurie...
answer: Good night... Jorgensen's been runnin' his cattle with my own...

question: YOUR cattle?... DEBBIE'S cattle!
answer: He's agreed to take you on and share the increase from my herd while I'm gone... I'll be pushin' on tomorrow...

question: I ain't stayin'... I set out lookin' for Debbie... I aim to keep on...
answer: Why?

question: Because she's my... my...
answer: She's your nothin'... She's no kin to you at all!

question: I always felt like she was... Her folks takin' me in, raisin' me like one of their own...
answer: That don't make 'em kin...

question: All right... I ain't got no kin... I'm goin' to keep lookin' that's all.
answer: How? You got any horses, or money to buy 'em... You ain't even got money to buy cartridges... Jorgensen's offering you a good livin' here... Martin... I want you to know somethin'...

question: Yeah... you want me to know I ain't got no kin -- no money -- no horses -- nothing but a dead man's clothes to wear!... You tole me that already... Now shut your head!
answer: Good night.

question: Ethan rode on... an hour ago. I don't know what you can do about finding Debbie that he can't... He'll find her now, Martie... Please believe me... I know.
answer: That's what scares me -- him findin' her. Laurie, I've seen his eyes when he so much as hears the word 'Comanche' ...I've seen him take his knife an' ...never mind... But he's a man can go crazy wild... It might come on him when it was the worst thing could be... What I counted on, I hoped to be there to stop him, if such thing come.

question: I hoped I could hold you here... But I guess I knew... So I stole this for you...
answer: 'I bought a small size dress off a Injun... If this here is a piece of yr chiles dress bring reward. I know where they gone... Jerem Futterman.' Futterman!... He's got a little tradin' post on the South Fork o' the Brazos... Laurie, I just got to get me a good horse! Think yer pa would...

question: Finish your breakfast...
answer: I gotta catch up with him, Laurie!

question: Go on then! Pa's in the barn saddlin' the Fort Worth stud... an' you can take the light gelding with the blaze...
answer: But that's Sweet-face -- your own good horse.

question: Take it and welcome... but don't count on finding me here when you get back... I've been dallying around this god-forsaken wind-scour almost two long years waitin' for you... I ain't cut out to be an old maid!
answer: I can't help it, Laurie... I just gotta catch up with Ethan...

question: Drink?
answer: How'd you come by this?

question: You said there'd be a thousand dollar reward.
answer: That's what I said.

question: You got it with you?
answer: Reward'll be paid when I find her -- an' if she's alive...

question: Man's got a right to expect some kind o' payment... I laid out for the dress an' sendin' you the writin'...
answer: Twenty Yankee dollars.

question: ...an' a man's time is worth somethin'...
answer: Talk!

question: A young buck fetched it in late last summer... Said it belonged to a captive chile of Chief Scar...
answer: Scar? Never heard of any Chief Scar.

question: Me neither... But this buck claimed he was a big war chief with the Nawyecky Comanches.
answer: Keep talking.

question: Scar's band was headin' north... to winter in at Fort Wingate... eatin' agency beef. That's what this buck said... Maybe he lied.
answer: And maybe you lie...

question: In that case you won't find her -- and I won't get my thousand dollars. Stay the night if you want... Cards?... A jug?... If you'd like some company, we got a few squaws on the place...
answer: No thanks.

question: Don't forget to come back with my thousand dollars.
answer: Ain't yours yet.

question: Smells a change in the weather... Wouldn't surprise me if we didn't have a frost 'fore mornin'... Here... Whyn't you bed down closer to the fire, boy?
answer: Hey! What's the idea...?

question: Maybe I'm gettin' like Mose Harper -- my bones is cold tonight...
answer: Funny... When we passed through Fort Wingate last winter, we didn't hear mention of any Nawyecky Comanche there...

question: Not so funny... if you recollect what 'Nawyecka' means...
answer: What's that?

question: Sorta like 'roundabout' -- like a man says he's goin' one place when he means to go just the reverse...
answer: Oh...

question: You all settled an' comfortable now? Thanks... you did just fine...
answer: Futterman?

question: He just couldn't wait...
answer: Whatchu doin'?...

question: Even got my twenty dollars back... We did all right.
answer: WE?... You just used me for bait -- staked me out like a... buildin' up the fire... fixin' it so's... I coulda had my brains blowed out! Suppose you'd missed!

question: Howdy, Mister Jorgensen...
answer: Charlie...

question: Got a letter here...
answer: By golly! A letter?

question: For Miss Laurie...
answer: Come in, Charlie, come in... LAURIE!... My land!... Two letters in the one year!... A letter for you, Laurie...

question: Yes'm... Figgered it might be the news you been waitin' for... so...
answer: Real good o' you to ride all the way over, Charlie... Might at least say your thank you's, Laurie... Declare!

question: No need to...
answer: Well?

question: You stay, Charlie... After all, Charlie brought the letter, Laurie... He got a right to listen too!
answer: Oh, all right! Well... Martin says...

question: From the beginning...
answer: 'Dear Miss Laury'... He spells it with a Y instead of an I... E... Wouldn't you think he'd know...

question: Who cares what he spells it? Read the letter.
answer: Dear Miss Laury... I take pen in hand to let you know Ethan and me still are trying to catch up with them Comanches the late Mister Futterman told us about... The late Mister Futterman?

question: Let's go... I think I stumbled onto somethin'...
answer: Scar?

question: When are you goin' to learn to keep your mouth shut! Come on. Let's get out of here.
answer: But I just bought a good blanket.

question: Forget it... What I heard back there was that a band o' hostile Nawyeckas came through this way less'n two weeks ago...
answer: Think it might be...?

question: What's she followin' for?
answer: Look, I changed my mind... You can keep your blanket. Go on back... Look... you don't understand... I don't want it.

question: YOU don't understand, ya chunkhead! You didn't buy any blanket! Ya bought her!
answer: What?

question: You got yourself a wife, sonny!
answer: Oh no! Tell her she's got to go back...

question: And have her whole family after our scalps for floutin' one o' their women?... No sir! Come on, Mrs. Pauley...
answer: Mrs... Pauley?

question: I got another gal purtier'n you. I got another gal purtier'n you. I got another gal purtier'n you. Skip to my Lou, my darlin'.
answer: Water!... Pah!

question: That's the way to train 'em. Looks like Mrs. Pauley's goin' to make you a fine beautiful wife...
answer: Cut it out, will ya... Look... I wish I could explain to you.

question: Says her name's Wild Goose Flying in the Night Sky... but she'll answer to Look since it pleases ya...
answer: Look? I don't think it's so funny... If you want to do some good, whyn't you ask her where Scar is?

question: She heard ya-all right... An' she knows... Unt osupanet cah-nay Scar? You ask her!
answer: Look! Scar?... Do you know where he went? And if he has a girl with him... a white girl -- nai-bist pabo taibo... No... not my wife... My... How do you say sister?

question: Nami.
answer: Beats me how she could get that pony out o' camp without neither of us hearin' a thing...

question: She ain't goin' back to her family, that's certain... not if she took off where the arrow points.
answer: Think she means for us to follow?

question: How should I know... She's YOUR wife!
answer: I think maybe we oughta...

question: Ethan, quit it!
answer: Nine... Ten!

question: What's the sense in it!
answer: Hunger! -- Empty bellies! That's the sense in it, you Cherokee!... Least, THEY won't feed any Comanches this winter... Killin' buffalo's as good as killin' Injuns in this country.

question: Peaceful tribes depend on the buffalo, too....
answer: Ain't that too bad... If you feel that sorry for your kinfolk, I'm surprised you didn't take up with that squaw wife of yours...

question: ETHAN! Listen!... Hear it?... There! Ain't that a bugle... and firing?
answer: Just hope we ain't too late...

question: And it was clear to me the hostiles outnumbered us four to one... with all the advantage of terrain... Sir -- we charged!... Gentlemen -- and I hope you will quote me -- I cannot say too much for the courage of the men who followed me into that Cheyenne camp...
answer: Cheyenne! What Cheyenne?

question: I beg your pardon?
answer: That camp you hit was Nawyecka Comanche... Chief Scar's bunch...

question: Are you getting this, Keefer?
answer: My name's Edwards... I'm looking for my niece... she was in that camp when you attacked...

question: I ain't sure... Where's that doll?
answer: Was your niece about their age?

question: Not far from it...
answer: Hard to realize they're white, isn't it...

question: They're not white any more -- they're Comanche!... Let's see the bodies... I don't need you...
answer: I'd like you to see them all... It might help us identify them... Shot in the head -- flash-burn range... The boy got his skull cracked... Here's the girl...

question: No... Well, we only got the one lead -- Scar... And where we begin to look, I don't know...
answer: There's one thing. We recovered a bushel of trinkets in that camp... cheap stuff... trade goods... Couldn't help noticing that most of it was Mexican... Maybe if you could talk to some of those Mexican traders along the border... What do they call themselves?

question: Comancheros...
answer: That's the breed... Course it might take time.

question: ...so we're setting out for New Mexico Territory in the morning... I am sorry I won't be back for Christmas again this year...
answer: And you knittin' that muffler...

question: What's the difference!
answer: Well, I just thought it would be a sin and a shame not to let SOMEONE get some good of it...

question: Recognize it? There couldn't be two like that in all the world... MOSE!.... MOSE HARPER?
answer: Ay-eh...?

question: Leggo my arm... You look mangier 'n ever.
answer: Ain't been too good... No sir, not too good... Gettin' old, Ethan...

question: Well, the reward still stands...
answer: Don't want no money, Ethan... jus' a place -- a roof over m' head... a little grub... a bunk to sleep in... an' a rockin' chair by the fire... my own rockin' chair by a fire...

question: You help me find her, you got your rockin' chair...
answer: Swear it, Ethan?... Given word?

question: Told ya, didn't I?
answer: Ethan... I found a man's seen her... knows where little Debbie is!

question: Come on, Don Juan... We're on our way...
answer: Lemme alone...

question: You breeds are all alike -- two drinks an'...
answer: Take yer hands off'n me... This lady an' me got some things to talk over!

question: Suit yourself... While you're enjoyin' your little conversation, I'll be ridin' out with Senor Fernandez here... The Comanch' medicine country ain't far... there's one camp with a chief named Cicatriz.
answer: Never heard of him...

question: Pie-kay! IH-CARD!
answer: Are those his wives too?

question: Two sons -- killed by white men... For each son, I take many scalps... Mayah-kay zee-eh!... MAYAH-KAY ZEE-EH! Pie-kay!
answer: I've seen scalps before...

question: This before?
answer: I came to trade, not to admire his collection... Tell him we're going to pitch camp across the crick... Maybe we can talk trade tomorrow.

question: You figger Scar means to kill us?
answer: He's got to... All these years, runnin', dodgin', knowin' we were after him... Now we caught up... It's him or us.

question: Why didn't he make his move back there?
answer: I don't know... Somethin' tied his hands... maybe hospitality...

question: Debbie...?
answer: Unnt-meah! Both men move closer. She takes a frightened step back, as if to run.

question: Debbie... Don't you remember me? I'm Martin.
answer: Unnt-meah!

question: Ee-sap! White men killed them - to steal cows! I was... little... I ran away... They find me... take care of me.
answer: No Debbie! That ain't what happened! They been lyin' to you...

question: You lie! All white men lie... and kill...
answer: Debbie, think back! I'm Martin... remember? Remember how I used to let you ride my horse? Tell you stories? Don't you remember me, Debbie?

question: I remember... from always... At first I prayed to you... come and get me... take me home... You didn't come...
answer: I've come now...

question: Go on! Get out of here while you can...
answer: Over there!

question: They'll be back...
answer: We won't be here... Come on!

question: Martha... Martha!
answer: I gotta open that leg and let the poison out...

question: Wait... Just in case... Read it.
answer: 'I, Ethan Edwards, being of sound mind and without any blood kin, do hereby bequeath all my property of any kind to Martin Pauley...' I don't want your property.... 'Sides, what do you mean no 'blood kin?' Debbie's your blood kin...

question: Not no more.
answer: You can keep your will! I ain't forgettin' you was all set to shoot her yourself... What kind o' man are you, anyway.

question: She's been with the bucks! She's nothin' now but a...
answer: Shut your dirty mouth! I hope you die!

question: What's goin' on?
answer: Why, my Laurie's getting married... Wait! Don't you hear me! The Rangers...

question: So what?
answer: You been posted for murder... both of you... That trader fella, the late Mister Futterman...

question: I gotta see Laurie!
answer: Go around the side... the grandmother's room... I'll tell her... PLEASE!

question: You better!
answer: Quick... hide in the barn, Ethan...

question: Hello, Martie....
answer: I... I wrote you a letter... Reckon you didn't get it...

question: One letter in five years... I read it till the paper dried up and the writing faded out...
answer: It wasn't much of a letter...

question: No, it wasn't... You mighta said you loved me... You mighta asked me to wait... At least that'd have been something...
answer: But I allus loved you... You know that, without my sayin' it... I couldn't bring myself to ask you to wait... the little I had... not knowin' how much longer until we found Debbie...

question: It isn't fair... It isn't fair, Martin Pauley, and you know it!
answer: Don't cry, Laurie... I understand how it is... I'll just go 'way...

question: I'll thank you to leave the room, Laurie.
answer: Charlie MacCorry!... You weren't fixin' to marry HIM??

question: She sure is!... An' don't think your comin' back is goin' to change it!
answer: As to that, I don't know, Charlie... We hadn't got around to talkin' marriage...

question: What right you got to be talkin' marriage to any decent woman...
answer: If you're talkin' about that crazy murder charge...

question: Now, now... let's not grow disputatious... What's that? More company? Kinda late getting here, aren't they?
answer: Is Captain Clayton here, Reverend?

question: I'm Clayton.
answer: You're Captain Clayton?... Colonel Greenhill's compliments, sir.

question: Hold on, son... Who's this Colonel Greenhill you're talking about?
answer: Why Colonel Greenhill is Colonel Greenhill, sir... Commanding Officer, Fifth U.S. Cavalry... I'm Lieutenant Greenhill, sir.

question: Oh... Now what's this your pa wants to know?
answer: My pa wants to know... Colonel Greenhill wants to know how soon you could put a company of your Rangers in the field, fully armed and equipped, for joint punitive action against the Comanches.

question: JOINT action?
answer: Yes sir... We've received information about a band of Comanches under a chief named Scar...

question: My guns...
answer: Martie... don't go! Not this time.

question: You crazy?
answer: It's too late... She's a woman grown now...

question: I got to fetch her home...
answer: Fetch what home?... The leavin's of Comanche bucks -- sold time an' again to the highest bidder?... With savage brats of her own, most like?...

question: Laurie! Shut your mouth!
answer: Do you know what Ethan will do if he has a chance?... He'll put a bullet in her brain! And I tell you Martha would want him to!

question: Enough to go around... I'd say about a dozen apiece... Mount 'em up!
answer: Wait! We go chargin' in, they'll kill her... and you know it.

question: It's what I'm countin' on.
answer: I know you are... Only it ain't goin' to be that way... she's alive...

question: Livin' with Comanches ain't bein' alive...
answer: She's alive... Better she's alive and livin' with Comanches than her brains bashed out...

question: What in...?
answer: Captain Clayton... Captain!

question: Go on! Whyn't you have your bugler sound the charge while you're at it??
answer: Sir?

question: Never mind... Your pa know you're out here?
answer: Yes, sir... Troop's about ten miles back... The Colonel sent me looking for you...

question: Well you found me... Good work, son... Good work.
answer: If there's anything I can do, sir...

question: God forbid... No, son, you flog on back and tell your pa where we're at... and where he's at...
answer: But he knows THAT, sir... Can't I stay, sir?

question: All right... But keep your eye on me, boy... I'm the hard case you're up against here -- not these childish savages... If you don't hear me first time I holler, you better read my mind... I don't aim to raise no two hollers on any subject at hand...
answer: Yes, sir...
